Guys, it takes less than 5 minutes to join the 2 parts if it really bothers you.

1. Get VirtualDub
2. Open VirtualDub and click on File > Open Video File
3. Grab the slider at the bottom of the video and drag it all the way to the end.
4. Click File > Append AVI Segment
5. Click on Video > Direct Stream Copy
6. Click on Audio > Direct Stream Copy
7. Click on File > Save AVI and name it whatever
8. ???
9. Profit
THANK YOU!

To merge video files in Linux, put both video files in the same folder (for ease of use). Open a terminal window and change directory to the folder with the video files. Type:

cat first_video.avi second_video.avi > full_video.avi

Obviously, replace with the original file names you are working with and the desired output file name.
